definition: to forget favors and violate justice (idiom); ingratitude to a friend/to kick a benefactor in the teeth

sentences.english: I will never make friends with such an ingrate again.
sentences.chinese: 我再也不跟像这样忘恩负义的人做朋友了。

sentences.english: He upbraided her with her ingratitude.
His ingratitude cut me to the heart.
sentences.chinese: 他的忘恩负义伤透了我的心。

sentences.english: Fagin had told O liver how ungrateful he had been to run away.
sentences.chinese: 费金已告诉他，逃跑是件忘恩负义的事。

sentences.english: Thanksgiving is a small German, ingrate is evil.
sentences.chinese: 感恩是小德，忘恩是大恶。

sentences.english: Power takes as ingratitude the writhings of its victims .
sentences.chinese: 势力以为牺牲者的痛苦是忘恩负义。

sentences.english: Kick the ingrate out of the country.
sentences.chinese: 把这个忘恩负义的混蛋踢出我们的国家。

sentences.english: The goatherd caught up with him and blamed his ungracious behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 牧羊人追上野山羊，责怪它忘恩负义。

sentences.english: There would be no cycles save for the never-ending cycle of ingratitude.
sentences.chinese: 从此除了忘恩负义的无休止循环将不再有其他循环了。

sentences.english: It's her ingratitude that grates on me.
sentences.chinese: 是她忘恩负义把我惹火了。

sentences.english: Ingratitude is the essence of vileness.
sentences.chinese: 忘恩负义是卑劣的本质。

sentences.english: The old man upbraided him with ingratitude .
sentences.chinese: 那位老人斥责他忘恩负义。

sentences.english: The people are poor but not of short, body rich cannot forget.
sentences.chinese: 人穷但不能志短，身富不能忘恩。

sentences.english: Verily, he is not indignant at their modes of consolation and ingratitude.
sentences.chinese: 其实，他并不气恼他们自我安慰和忘恩负义的模式。

sentences.english: Thankless people fall in trouble, can't be saved.
sentences.chinese: 忘恩的人落在困难之中，是不能得救的。
真正丢人的是忘恩和无礼。

definition: to forget favors and violate justice (idiom); ingratitude to a friend/to kick a benefactor in the teeth
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
grateful and seeking to repay the kindness (idiom)
breaking faith and abandoning right (idiom); to betray/treachery/perfidy
lit. heart of wolf and lungs of dog (idiom)/cruel and unscrupulous
to see profit and forget morality (idiom); to act from mercenary considerations/to sell one's soul for gain
lit. to destroy the bridge after crossing the river (idiom)/fig. to abandon one's benefactor upon achieving one's goal
to go back on one's word/to break one's promise/to be unfaithful/to be untrustworthy
